Tips.TipOfTheDay:
If you find bugs or have an idea for a new feature, file an issue on Trac
http://trac.osgeo.org/mapguide
Please be a descriptive as possible when filing issues. For bugs, a step-by-step process of reproducing the bug is very helpful.

Drag and drop a MapGuide package file into the Site Explorer to load it
Similarly, drag and drop a SDF, SHP or SQLite file to create a Feature Source of the same type.

The Edit as XML toolbar command allows you to edit the XML content of any open resource.
Once complete, the open editor will be re-initialized with the latest XML content.

Resource validation can detect and diagnose many common MapGuide problems.
To validate a resource, right click it in the Site Explorer and choose "Validate"
The Site Explorer supports multiple selection. You can now copy/move/validate multiple selected resources at once!

Have a lot of custom commands in your Web Layout?
You can use the Import/Export functionality in the Web Layout editor to copy and move these commands between web layouts.
If Maestro cannot find a specialized editor that supports the resource you want to open, it will use the XML editor as a fallback option.

The New Resource dialog supports custom user resource templates.
Simply drop your XML file into the User Template directory and the New Resource dialog will load this template under the "User Defined" category.

Items in the Site Explorer are colored based on whether they are open and/or have been edited.
You can configure these colors in the Maestro options.

The Local Feature Source Preview tool is a powerful way to inspect the data and structure of any Feature Source.
This tool is accessible from the Tools menu and also the Feature Source editor.

MgCooker is a utility to pre-generate tiles, resulting in faster tiled maps.
This tool is accessible from the Tools menu and also the Map Definition editor.

If you want to use Google/Bing/Yahoo maps with Fusion, your Map Definition needs to be in the Popular Visualisation Mercator coordinate system.
The coordinate system code for this is WGS84.PseudoMercator

If you want to use Google/Bing/Yahoo maps with Fusion, Google and Yahoo maps require API keys. Bing does not require API keys.
Please carefully read the terms and conditions of each respective mapping provider.
Previews of Symbols from a Symbol Library in the Layer Definition editor will currently only show the Symbol as-is. It won't take into account the size and color override settings of your point rule.
Want to know what's new in this release? Check out the changelog.txt in the Maestro installation directory.

Check out the author's blog for other MapGuide, Maestro and FDO tips and tricks.
http://themapguyde.blogspot.com

The donation link is in the about dialog under: Help - About
The coordinate system picker allows fast coordinate system lookup by code, WKT and EPSG number.
The repointer context command allows you to redirect all current references to the selected resource to reference another resource of your choice.
You can clear any cached feature source schema information by right-clicking the feature source in the Site Explorer and selecting the "Purge Cached Schema Information" context menu command.

Maestro only supports a sub-set of Load Procedures. Maestro does not support the following Load Procedure types:
- DWG Load Procedure type and any of its associated options - Raster Load Procedure type and any of its associated options - Convert to SDF option (SDF/SHP Load Procedures) - Generalization of data - SDF2 to SDF3 conversion
